cell.paragraph:
Right clicking on any item displayed in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/40_object_browser/index.htm Object Browser will open a context menu for that item, as demonstrated in the following screenshot:

In this example, the tree node representing the Eiffel class APPLICATION is the subject of the context menu, which was opened as the result of a right click. The entries available on the context menu perform the following actions:

list.item:
Go to Definition - Opens the Eiffel class containing the definition in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/50_The_Eiffel_Editor/index.htm Editor .

Browse Definition - Sends the current target of the menu, to the current
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/40_object_browser/index.htm Object Browser .
Quick Find Symbol - Performs a quick find using the text of the curent target as the search argument.
Copy - Copies the text of the current target to the clipboard.

Sort Alphabetically - Sorts all items in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/40_object_browser/index.htm Object Browser alphabetically.

Sort By Type - Sorts all items in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/40_object_browser/index.htm Object Browser by type.

Sort By Access - Sorts all items in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/40_object_browser/index.htm Object Browser by access type.

Group By Type - Sorts all items in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/40_object_browser/index.htm Object Browser by type.

cell.paragraph:
Depending on the type of node that you select in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/40_object_browser/index.htm Object Browser , the context menu may change to only display a subset of these entries listed above.
